description.narrative: Hromadske TV becomes a mission-driven, more rule-based, governance healthier, financially more resilient and strategically oriented organisation.

Hromadkse TV har ansökt om kärnstöd (3 år) som kommer att täcka deras strategi (håller på att utvecklas). Insatsen består av 2 faser: det förberedande stödet och kärnstöd. Med tanke på organisationens institutionella omognad och dess efterfrågade funktion på medielandskapet i avsaknad av en allmän sändning. Den svenska ambassaden har bestämt att arbeta under en längre period med Hromadske TV under det förberedande stödet. Det förberedande stödet kommer därför att bestå av 2-3 förbättringsprojekt (i stället för en). Sida kommer att behålla rätten att förlänga det förberedande stödet eller att avbryta avtalet, om riskerna i organisationen ökar. Den totala budgeten är 10 000 000 SEK och omfattar det förberedande stödet och kärnstöd. Syftet är att betydligt förbättra alla interna system, och efter utarbetandet av strategin förväntas Hromadske TV att genomföra denna strategi enligt den utvecklade resultatramverket. Undantaget från insatsregeln: organisationen ska placera finansiella medel på ett icke-räntebärande konto, då det för närvarande inte finns förutsättningar i Ukrainas lagstiftning för att enskilda organisationer ska kunna placera medel på ett räntebärande konto och sedan skicka ränta tillbaka till givare. *** Hromadkse TV approached Sida for possible core support over 3 full years and duration of their strategy, which is being developed. The intervention envisages two phases: pre-core support and core support. In view of the immaturity of the organisation from the institutional point of view, taking into consideration its highly demanded function on the media landscape in the absence of a public broadcasting service, as well as its production effectiveness and talent since late 2013, the Swedish Embassy decided to work longer with Hromadske TV on pre-core support. The pre-core support will therefore consist of 2-3 improvement projects (instead of one). Sida will leave the right to extend the pre-core support phase or to get out of the agreement, should the risks in the organisation increase. The intervention's two-phase (pre-core and core support) total budget is 10 000 000 SEK and is aimed at significant improvements of all internal systems as the core support methodology requires, and upon finalisation of the strategy, Hromadske TV is supposed to implement this strategy according to the developed Results Assessment Framework. The exception from the Contribution Management Rule: The financing provided by Sida shall be deposited by the organization on a noninterest bearing account, as there are at the moment no legal provisions in Ukraine for nongovernmental organizations to place funds on an interest bearing account and send the interest income back to the sponsor.

The contribution aims at a combination of project and institutional support to the community Hromadske TV based in Kyiv with regional media contributors throughout Ukraine. Set up by reform minded indepdent journalists in November 2013, the resource showed its mettle through the Maydan and beyond. Its role will be hugely amplified through organisational, business and administrative support

description.narrative: In March 2015 Sida entered into Agreement on core support to NGO “Public Television” that would potentially cover 2015-2018. The template for the Agreement included pre-core support phase to followed by core support only in case efficiency audit recommendations are fulfilled by the cooperation partner upon the completion of pre-core support period. Upon the completion of the Pre-core phase, in 2016 Sida decided to change the modality of support for the cooperation partner from core support to bridge funding (contribution ID 10661) due to increasing insecurity of the sustainability of the contribution. This Agreement therefore was terminated and further substituted by grant agreement. This decision was based on monitoring findings and recommendations of verification/efficiency audit by KPMG completed in 2016.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
